did.unittitle: The first public commemoration of the anniversary of the death of Stephen C. Foster. "Left to Right:-Rev. Harry B. Heald, Rector of St. Andrew's Protestant Episcopal Church; Mrs. H. Talbot Peterson, member of the Civic Club Community Music Committee; Mrs. Alexander Dallas Rose, granddaughter of the composer; Miss H. Marie Dermitt, Secretary of the Civic Club of Allegheny County; Dallas Rose, great-grandson of Foster; Mrs. E.B. Lee, member of the Municipal Music Committee of the Civic Club; Mrs. Charles T. Manning, relative of Foster; Miss Emelie McCreery, member of the Municipal Music Committee of the Civic Club; Mrs. Ralph L. Hill, Dr. Ralph L. Hill, friends of the Foster family; Mr. Rose and Carl Whitmer, members of the Municipal Music Committee of the Civic Club

did.unittitle: "Kostalauch, April, 1941" laying "The Civic Club" wreath at the grave of Stephen C. Foster. "Left to Right: William J. O'Briem, Jr., Western Pennsylvania Manager for American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers. Miss Helene Beegle. Walter Horigan, Chairman of the Memorial Art Association, Mrs. Alexander Dallas Rose, Granddaughter of Stephen C. Foster. Back of Mrs. Rose is Fletcher Hodges, Curator of the Foster Memorial of the University of Pittsburgh. Burton H. Mustin, prominent musician and Chairman of the Stephen C. Foster Commemoration Committee of the Civic Club of Allegheny County. Mrs. Dorothy Rose Melady, Great Granddaughter of Stephen C. Foster
